contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 26, 2015 D Swiss Open
Swiss Open 0 March, Hymn and Own Choice Test Piece Contest
swiss-open
Swiss Open Contest presented nearly 50 different Bands from 11 Countries in it's 25 Years of History till 2014. It was held in Kultur-Casino Bern first and since 1999 the 'Salle Blanche' in KKL Luzern provides a wonderful Frame for this popular Event.
See Also Contest Website: http://www.worldbandfestival.ch/ Switzerland
Set Test and Own Choice
Of Distant Memories
Kultur und Kongresszentrum (KKL), Luzern, Switzerland (Local Brass Band Bürgermusik Luzern this Year absent due to Participation at the British Open, qualified at EBBC 2014)
Best March: Brass Band Fribourg Best Own Choice: Brass Band 13 Etoiles
Sept. 24, 2014, 8:23 a.m. Sept. 22, 2017, 4:39 p.m.
1 Brass Band Treize Etoiles James Gourlay Hunnenschlacht (The Battle of the Huns) [F. Liszt, arr. B, Moren]
2 Brass Band Fribourg Frédéric Théodoloz Piano Concerto No 3 - Finale [Rachmaninov]
3 Valaisia Brass Band Arsène Duc Uranus & Jupiter (from The Planets Suite) [G. Holst, arr. Roberts]
4 Ensemble de Cuivres Valaisan Francois Roh Scythian Suite [Prokofjev]
5 Brass Band Luzern Land Herve Grelat Firebird (excerpts)
6 Brass Band Berner Oberland Corsin Tuor Les Vêpres Siciliennes [arr. Lorriman]
7 Wallberg Brass Band Garry Cutt Overture to Rienzi [arr. Lorriman]
8 Oberaargauer Brass Band Russell Gray The Love for Three Oranges [Prokofjev]
9 Ensemble de Cuivres Melodia Stéphane Duboux Le Carnaval Romain [arr. Lorriman]
10 Liberty Brass Band Ostschweiz Andreas Koller Freischütz Overture [arr. Wüthrich]
